intro: Lasinia, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. Native to southern Africa, it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and produces small, daisy-like blooms. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
